current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To revise reporting requirements under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to preserve
			 the privacy of individuals, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
should strike the appropriate balance between sufficient reporting to
			 enforce the law and protecting the privacy of individuals.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text:
Protection of the primary insured individual and each other individual covered under the policy,
			 which should include minimizing the transmittal of social security
			 numbers, should be a priority when implementing reporting requirements.

is amended by adding at the
			 end the following flush sentence:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in the case of an individual other than the primary insured,
			 if the health insurance issuer or the employer does not collect or
			 maintain information on the TINs of such individuals (other than for
			 purposes of this section), the individual's name and date of birth may be
			 substituted for the name and TIN.

text.#text:
The amendment made by this section shall apply to returns the due date for which is after December
			 31, 2013.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following flush sentence:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

quoted-block-continuation-text.#text:
An individual shall be deemed to have consented to receive the statement under this section in
			 electronic form if such individual has consented at any prior time, to a
			 person required to furnish to such individual any statement for use in
			 filing the return of tax, to
			 receive such statement in electronic form, unless the
			 individual explicitly refuses such consent.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following new paragraph:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text: Statements relating to health insurance coverage

text.#text:
An individual shall be deemed to have consented to receive the statement under this subsection in
			 electronic form if such individual has consented at any prior time to
			 receive in electronic form any private health information (such as
			 electronic health records) furnished to such individual by the person
			 required to make such statement, unless the individual explicitly refuses
			 such consent.

The amendments made by this section shall apply to statements the due date for which is after
			 December 31, 2013.
